answers.answer: Sorry to hear you are having a bad time.I'm currently pregnant with my 1st so can't provide a past experience. Can you not call your DR and get them to explain to you exactly what is happening? I did read your last comment and it seemed as though your DR was not concerned but I really think the only way to put your mind at ease is to speak to them again and ask any questions that you have. I know it's easier said than done but don't worry I'm sure everything is fine. No point worrying yourself sick, call your DR x
Have a lot of faith that everything is going to be okay, don't put any more stress on your baby and yourself...God will bless you.

Yea I have an appointment on Tuesday and I can't wait so I can talk to my doctor about all my worries I feel as off I'm falling into depression about it I can't eat I keep crying I can't focus my mind is so lost and I keep getting asked what's wrong cause I can't hide that I'm worry I guess and I'm trying to be positive but it's like I can't :/  & thank u I hope my baby is fine too

I am so sorry to hear this. Hope you talk to your doctor soon about this but the safest way is to get an appointment from another doctor who can perform an anomaly/anatomy scan for the measurements. You will have to spent some money for the scanning but it's worth as you are depressed at this moment. Depression or worrying will not do any good to you and your baby. And what I think is your baby should be alright although her legs look shorter in the ultrasound as not all ultrasound measurements are accurate. And after reading your post I just googled to see if that's normal in other discussion threads and found out that A lot of mommas  than you think have experienced the same situation of yours about their babies legs being smaller in the ultrasound and their babies born perfectly normal. So just pray from God and relax hun. Relaxing will make you feel better and won't elevate your blood pressure.

My doctor sent me to a specialist for gestational diabetes and that's when I found out so I'm thinking what if I didn't have gestational diabetes I would of never known?? And well the doctor said bc I'm little 4"10 my daughter most likely just taking it her height after me I'm small so he thinks she should be good bc everything else in the ultrasound looked perfect but he gave me another appointment in 4 weeks to see how she's progressing and I'm so nervousss ugh

A women I worked with was told with both her pregnancy 'oh the legs are measuring smaller' they asked if there was any family history of dwarfism.. there is not!!Both her daughters are perfectly fine, not a thing wrong with them. They are simply petite little girl!!!I would try not to stress and worry, it isn't good for either you or your baby. Ultrasounds are not 100% accurate, if your ultrasound tech/ doctor did not voice any concerns then I am sure that your little one is perfectly fine :)It is a worry though, but children are and I think we will be worried about them even when they are grown with families of their own.All the best!
True that, & I'll love my baby no matter what I Just want her to be healthy that's all

One of my friends was told that her son's legs were measuring short so she worried about it her entire pregnancy. They ended up being perfect and it was just because of how he was positioned that they measured incorrectly.

Aw I hope my baby was position weird that day bc at 30Weeks I had a ultrasound and everything was fine that's why I surprised to hear that at the specialist I'm hoping its bc I'm so little she was just position weird or something bc my midwife did tell me my belly was all baby and the only way my baby had to grow was out bc of me being so small

So I went to my doctor today and was told my baby is healthy she's just on the smaller side bc I'm small and I have nothing to worry about bc she looked perfect in the ultrasound I feel so much better now that I talked to my doctor I feel soooo stress free now and happy to hear my doctor say everything is ok ! Thank u guys for trying to make me feel better and like they told me stay off doctor Google and listen to them
Yay that's brilliant so glad you can relax and enjoy the rest of your pregnancy. It's absolutely normal to fear the worst but great that you have the news you wanted :)  xxx

question: I know I posted about this already but I feel like only you moms can understand me and help me out and make me feel better but like I had posted here before last week I was told my baby's legs are measuring 3 weeks behind everything else is perfect and well last week i was 33 weeks and her legs 30 weeks and I've been loosing so much sleep about it I am mentally and physically drained thinking about it my baby shower was yesterday and I didn't even enjoy it how I should have thinking what if something is wrong with my baby ? That's been on my mind since my doctor appointment today I left work bc I couldn't concentrate my brain is soooo exhausted thinking about it ! Has anyone else gone through this and their baby was perfectly fine ?
title: Not enjoying my pregnancy anymore :,(
